snippet: A measure, which still faces a battle in the House, would restore assistance for Americans who have been unemployed for a half-year or longer.
abstract: Senate reaches agreement to pay for an extension of unemployment assistance program that expired in December 2013, leaving more than one million Americans who have been out of work for half-year or longer without support from federal government; getting $10 billion measure through Republican-controlled House will be another battle altogether.
lead_paragraph: A measure, which still faces a battle in the House, would restore assistance for Americans who have been unemployed for a half-year or longer.

headline.main: Senate Deal Is Reached on Restoring Jobless Aid
headline.print_headline: Senate Deal Is Reached on Restoring Jobless Aid
